title: How to get Riot to discuss your ban?
body: So i arrived back from holidays and found my account to be permanent banned, i know of someone that had details to the account besides myself and i was unable to use the account for just over a month. The ban was due to verbal abuse and i know this player to be relatively toxic, is there any way i can talk to someone at riot regarding my ban, as i was not the one that was playing when this permanent ban has been handed out to the account. ?

replies.body: You took the risk of handing out your account to a questionable person, well, behold the end result. Whether or not it wasnt you, or a lie, dont matter. You shared your account to get boosted.
I didn't get boosted, i asked for someone to do me up some  decent rune pages when i hit level 30 and was playing ranked, but ok.

You can appeal a ban by submitting a ticket to [Support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us), however you'll probably receive a response along the lines of "account security is your responsibility, you shouldn't hand out your login details and should change them if you think someone else has access to the account". I doubt they'd revoke the ban, considering the circumstances.
Idiot OP, account sharing is against the rules, don't bother trying to talk to Riot you aren't getting your account back.
Account sharing is also a bannable offence, so even if you didn't commit the crime the account was banned for, admitting you share the account is grounds for a ban anyway.
Wow guys, don't forget that OP is not the enemy. Account banning exists for one thing and one thing only, to raise revenue for riot.
